Uses of Class
system.Order

  • Packages that use Order 
    Package Description
    clui
    This package contains the clui command classes of the system (ie the LogIn, LogOut, RegisterRestaurant, RegisterCustomer, RegisterCourier, AddDishRestaurantMenu, ReateMeal, LogaddDish2MealOut, RemoveItemFromMeal, ShowMeal, SaveMeal, SetSpecialOffer, RemoveSepcialOffer, CreateOrder, AddItem2Order, AddMeal2Order, EndOrder, OnDuty, OffDuty, FindDeliverer, SetDeliveryPolicy, SetProfitPolicy, AssociatedCard, ShowListOfOrdersCompleted, ShowCourierDeliveries, ShowCouriersRegistered, ShowRestaurantsRegistered, ShowRestaurantTop, ShowCustomers, ShowMenuItem, ShowTotalProfit, ShowTotalProfit, GetParameterToTargetProfit, InitCore classes), responsible for processing user's commands of the MyFoodora system.
    system
    This package contains the Core class of the system.
    tests
    This package contains the JUnits tests of Part1 of this project.
    users
    This package contains the users classes of the system (ie the Courier, Customer, Manager, Restaurant and User classes), responsible for creating Users of the MyFoodora system.

      Methods in users with parameters of type Order 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean Courier.acceptOrder(Order order)
      The courier accepts an order, setting it to its current order, changing his state to OnDuty, calculating the delivery date estimation and adding 1 to the num of orders completed
      void Courier.addNewOrder(Order order)
      Adds an order to the list of pending orders of a courier.
      boolean Courier.decideAddOrder(Order order)
      Function that simulates the reaction of a courier to an order: assigns a probability of 1% that the courier will decline to add the order to its list of pending orders and calls the functions acceptOrder or refuseOrder accordingly.
      boolean Courier.decideTakingOrder(Order order)
      Function that simulates the reaction of a courier to an order: assigns a probability of 5% that the courier will decline the order and calls the functions acceptOrder or refuseOrder accordingly.
      void Courier.setCurrentOrder(Order currentOrder)
